column1: '''Telerin''' was a word used to refer to the tongues of any Elf-people that are of [[Lindar]] origin but is best reserved for the language of the Teleri that came to [[Valinor]]
column3: p.77</ref>; it is a tongue related to both [[Quenya]] and [[Sindarin]].

column1: The language of the Falmari descended from [[Common Telerin]]
column2: an ancient dialect of the [[Common Eldarin]] spoken during the [[Great March]]. From the viewpoint of the speakers of [[Quenya]] (who considered their language the main direct descendant of Common Eldarin)
column3: they considered Telerin (a direct descendant of Common Telerin) a "dialect of Quenya". Telerin was therefore considered a closely related language still largely intelligible.<ref>{{WJ|Quendi}}</ref>

column2: the phonology of the two languages differed much
column3: with Telerin often being more conservative than [[Quenya]]. In [[Aman]] the speakers of Telerin outnumbered the speakers of [[Quenya]]
column4: much as the [[Teleri]] outnumbered the [[Vanyar]] and [[Noldor]].

column2: made the Noldor to differientate themselves from the [[Vanyarin|speech of the Vanyar]]. For example the Vanyar pronounced /f/ very soft
column4: but the Noldor resisted this change through influence from the Teleri.<ref>{{PM|Shibboleth}}</ref>

column2: the Teleri prized silver above gold
column3: and their skill as silversmiths was esteemed even by the Noldor who seemed to prefer the Telerin word ''[[telpe]]'' "silver" intead the Quenya form ''[[tyelpë]]''.<ref>{{UT|6e}}</ref>

column1: [[Finarfin]] is said to have learned Telerin. He also gave his sons Telerin-influenced Quenya names.
A notable difference from Quenya was that the possessive endings were suffixed to a word of something possessed
column2: not possessing. For example "[[Olwe]]'s house" is ''[[cava]]ria Olue'' (lit. house-his Olue).{{fact}}

column1: ''Telerin'' is a name of a language appearing in ''[[The Etymologies]]''
column2: where about 25 words of that language are given.<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}</ref> This version of Telerin was more related to [[Ilkorin]] than to [[Qenya]] or [[Kornoldorin]].{{fact}}
